trans-unit.source: What are Service Bus Topics and Subscriptions?
trans-unit.target: What are Service Bus Topics and Subscriptions?

trans-unit.source: Service Bus topics and subscriptions support a *publish/subscribe*
trans-unit.target: Service Bus topics and subscriptions support a *publish/subscribe*

trans-unit.source: messaging communication model.
trans-unit.target: messaging communication model.

trans-unit.source: When using topics and subscriptions,
trans-unit.target: When using topics and subscriptions,

trans-unit.source: components of a distributed application do not communicate directly with
trans-unit.target: components of a distributed application do not communicate directly with

trans-unit.source: each other; instead they exchange messages via a topic, which acts as an
trans-unit.target: each other; instead they exchange messages via a topic, which acts as an

trans-unit.source: intermediary.
trans-unit.target: intermediary.

trans-unit.source: TopicConcepts
trans-unit.target: TopicConcepts

trans-unit.source: In contrast with Service Bus queues, in which each message is processed by a
trans-unit.target: In contrast with Service Bus queues, in which each message is processed by a

trans-unit.source: single consumer, topics and subscriptions provide a "one-to-many" form
trans-unit.target: single consumer, topics and subscriptions provide a "one-to-many" form

trans-unit.source: of communication, using a publish/subscribe pattern.
trans-unit.target: of communication, using a publish/subscribe pattern.

trans-unit.source: It is possible to
trans-unit.target: It is possible to

trans-unit.source: register multiple subscriptions to a topic.
trans-unit.target: register multiple subscriptions to a topic.

trans-unit.source: When a message is sent to a
trans-unit.target: When a message is sent to a

trans-unit.source: topic, it is then made available to each subscription to handle/process
trans-unit.target: topic, it is then made available to each subscription to handle/process

trans-unit.source: independently.
trans-unit.target: independently.

trans-unit.source: A subscription to a topic resembles a virtual queue that receives copies of
trans-unit.target: A subscription to a topic resembles a virtual queue that receives copies of

trans-unit.source: the messages that were sent to the topic.
trans-unit.target: the messages that were sent to the topic.

trans-unit.source: You can optionally register
trans-unit.target: You can optionally register

trans-unit.source: filter rules for a topic on a per-subscription basis, which allows you
trans-unit.target: filter rules for a topic on a per-subscription basis, which allows you

trans-unit.source: to filter/restrict which messages to a topic are received by which topic
trans-unit.target: to filter/restrict which messages to a topic are received by which topic

trans-unit.source: subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: Service Bus topics and subscriptions enable you to scale to process a
trans-unit.target: Service Bus topics and subscriptions enable you to scale to process a

trans-unit.source: very large number of messages across a very large number of users and
trans-unit.target: very large number of messages across a very large number of users and

trans-unit.source: applications.
trans-unit.target: applications.

trans-unit.source: Create a service namespace
trans-unit.target: Create a service namespace

trans-unit.source: To begin using Service Bus topics and subscriptions in Azure,
trans-unit.target: To begin using Service Bus topics and subscriptions in Azure,

trans-unit.source: you must first create a service namespace.
trans-unit.target: you must first create a service namespace.

trans-unit.source: A service namespace provides
trans-unit.target: A service namespace provides

trans-unit.source: a scoping container for addressing Service Bus resources within your
trans-unit.target: a scoping container for addressing Service Bus resources within your

trans-unit.source: application.
trans-unit.target: application.

trans-unit.source: To create a service namespace:
trans-unit.target: To create a service namespace:

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal][].
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal][].

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation pane of the Management Portal, click
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation pane of the Management Portal, click

trans-unit.source: **Service Bus**.
trans-unit.target: **Service Bus**.

trans-unit.source: In the lower pane of the Management Portal, click **Create**.
trans-unit.target: In the lower pane of the Management Portal, click **Create**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Add a new namespace** dialog, enter a namespace name.
trans-unit.target: In the **Add a new namespace** dialog, enter a namespace name.

trans-unit.source: The system immediately checks to see if the name is available.
trans-unit.target: The system immediately checks to see if the name is available.

trans-unit.source: After making sure the namespace name is available, choose the
trans-unit.target: After making sure the namespace name is available, choose the

trans-unit.source: country or region in which your namespace should be hosted (make
trans-unit.target: country or region in which your namespace should be hosted (make

trans-unit.source: sure you use the same country/region in which you are deploying your
trans-unit.target: sure you use the same country/region in which you are deploying your

trans-unit.source: compute resources).
trans-unit.target: compute resources).

trans-unit.source: IMPORTANT: Pick the **same region** that you intend to choose for
trans-unit.target: IMPORTANT: Pick the **same region** that you intend to choose for

trans-unit.source: deploying your application.
trans-unit.target: deploying your application.

trans-unit.source: This will give you the best performance.
trans-unit.target: This will give you the best performance.

trans-unit.source: Leave the other fields in the dialog with their default values (**Messaging** and **Standard Tier**), then click the check mark.
trans-unit.target: Leave the other fields in the dialog with their default values (**Messaging** and **Standard Tier**), then click the check mark.

trans-unit.source: The system now creates your service
trans-unit.target: The system now creates your service

trans-unit.source: namespace and enables it.
trans-unit.target: namespace and enables it.

trans-unit.source: You might have to wait several minutes as
trans-unit.target: You might have to wait several minutes as

trans-unit.source: the system provisions resources for your account.
trans-unit.target: the system provisions resources for your account.

trans-unit.source: Obtain the default management credentials for the namespace
trans-unit.target: Obtain the default management credentials for the namespace

trans-unit.source: In order to perform management operations, such as creating a topic or
trans-unit.target: In order to perform management operations, such as creating a topic or

trans-unit.source: subscription on the new namespace, you must obtain the management
trans-unit.target: subscription on the new namespace, you must obtain the management

trans-unit.source: credentials for the namespace.
trans-unit.target: credentials for the namespace.

trans-unit.source: You can obtain these credentials from the Azure management portal.
trans-unit.target: You can obtain these credentials from the Azure management portal.

trans-unit.source: To obtain management credentials from the portal
trans-unit.target: To obtain management credentials from the portal

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation pane, click the **Service Bus** node to
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation pane, click the **Service Bus** node to

trans-unit.source: display the list of available namespaces:
trans-unit.target: display the list of available namespaces:

trans-unit.source: Click on the namespace you just created from the list shown:
trans-unit.target: Click on the namespace you just created from the list shown:

trans-unit.source: Click **Configure** to view the shared access policies for your namespace.
trans-unit.target: Click **Configure** to view the shared access policies for your namespace.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of the primary key, or copy it to the clipboard.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of the primary key, or copy it to the clipboard.
